members.joinCircumstances: First crew member to join Luffy
Joined after the Arlong Park arc
Rejoined after genuinely apologizing for his actions during the Water 7 arc
Joined after the Drum Island arc
Joined after Alabasta arc, officially rejoined after Enies Lobby
Joined at the end of the Water 7 saga

keyMoments.title: Usopp Rejoins the Straw Hat Pirates
keyMoments.description: Usopp officially rejoins the crew after giving a heartfelt apology for his actions during the Water 7 arc.
keyMoments.significance: Resolves the major internal conflict from the Water 7 arc and completes the crew after adding Franky.

keyMoments.title: Departure from Water 7
keyMoments.description: The Straw Hat Pirates depart from Water 7 aboard the Thousand Sunny, marking the end of the Water 7 saga.
keyMoments.significance: The crew begins their next adventure with a new ship, new member (Franky), and reunited with Usopp.

keyMoments.title: Defense Against Garp's Attack
keyMoments.description: The complete crew works together for the first time on the Thousand Sunny to defend against Garp's bombardment.
keyMoments.significance: First time the post-Enies Lobby crew (including Franky and the returned Usopp) fights together as a unit.

ships.description: Built by Franky and Galley-La Company from Adam Wood. Episode 323 marks its first voyage with the complete crew.

jollyRoger.description: A skull wearing a straw hat with crossed bones behind it

keyMoments.title: Garp's Pursuit of the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Vice Admiral Garp arrives at Water 7 with Marine forces to capture the Straw Hat Pirates.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the Marines' continued pursuit of the Straw Hats after their assault on Enies Lobby.

keyMoments.title: Garp's Genkotsu Meteor Bombardment
keyMoments.description: Garp bombards the Thousand Sunny with his Genkotsu Meteor technique, throwing cannonballs with superhuman strength.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of one of Garp's signature techniques.
